courses.courseHeading: How to design when you're burnt out
courses.courseDescription: If you're a designer, there's a high chance you've experienced burnout in your practice. You've probably also had to design while burnt out, which is not an easy task. So, what causes burnout? In this course, we will answer that question and reclaim the joy in our design practices.

In this course, Students work through a full project cycle to develop a responsible interactive design project informed through research and critical assessment. They apply knowledge and skills of human-centered design, Information and visual design and computational media to produce a final individual capstone project.

Students apply the fundamental principles of interaction design to organize and structure content for a range of interactive experiences. They use the visual strategies of Information Architecture and investigate how users read screen-based content and develop techniques for making content appropriate for interactive operations.

This course lays the essential foundation your designn skills .  Through exercises and projects, students investigate the application of behavioural psychology, UX psychology, usability methodologies, hierarchy and visual design principles to the fundamentals of human computer interaction.

This course draws on design methodologies, processes and skills acquired in previous courses as students produce an independent interaction design research project under the supervision of a faculty member to fulfill emerging consumer needs.
